step1.sentence: It takes months to build trust and only moments to lose it.

step2.story: The new platform had a privacy policy that was actually readable. The company had invested in plain-language legal writing specifically to build trust with users who had grown skeptical of fine print.

step3.story: The community organizer had been working in the neighborhood for a year before she held her first public meeting. She had spent that year attending other people's events, listening without agenda, and doing small things she had promised to do. By the time she invited people to participate in something she was organizing, the room was full. Building trust, she explained to a colleague who asked how she had done it, was not a communication strategy. It was a long series of small consistent actions that accumulated into credibility. There was no shortcut because trust was, essentially, the record of what you had done before.
